macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Market Sell-Off Driven by Tech Losses and Risk Appetite Decline
items.summary: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell 1.2% and 1.4% respectively as investors rotated out of tech stocks, precious metals, and crypto assets amid concerns over AI capital expenditure overspending, labor market anxiety, and Fed policy uncertainty.

items.title: US Jobless Claims Surge More Than Expected
items.summary: Initial jobless claims rose significantly beyond market expectations, adding to concerns about the health of the US labor market and contributing to the broader risk-off sentiment in markets.

items.title: ECB Maintains Rates Unchanged at First 2026 Meeting
items.summary: The European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged at its first policy meeting of 2026, while eurozone inflation fell to its lowest level in more than a year.

items.title: Major Index Declines Across Global Markets
items.summary: The Dow Jones fell 1.20% to 48,909, Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped 1.21% to 26,560, and the Shanghai Composite declined 0.25% to 4,066, while the Nikkei 225 gained 0.81% to 54,254.

items.title: Bitcoin Treasury Company Shares Plummet Amid Crypto Liquidations
items.summary: Shares in Strategy, the largest bitcoin Treasury Company, dropped 17% in a single day and are down 32% year-to-date as leveraged position liquidations add to selling pressure in crypto assets.

items.title: Mining Stocks Decline Sharply on Risk-Off Sentiment
items.summary: Major mining companies experienced significant losses, with BHP down 3.1% overnight and 3.5% weekly, Freeport-McMoRan falling 4.3% overnight and 9.1% weekly, and Vale declining 4.4% overnight.

items.title: US Treasury Yields Decline Amid Flight to Safety
items.summary: The 10-year US Treasury yield fell to 4.20% as investors rotated into US debt, while the 2-year yield traded around 3.5%, reflecting reduced risk appetite and expectations of potential Fed policy shifts.

items.title: Dollar Firms as Investors Seek Safe Haven Assets
items.summary: The US Dollar Index strengthened to 97.86 as investors shunned riskier assets ahead of central bank decisions, with the dollar gaining support despite concerns about US economic health.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crashes to $60K Amid Whale and ETF Selloffs
items.summary: Bitcoin experienced a sharp decline, dropping from over $90K two weeks ago to around $60K-$65K, with whales and spot BTC ETFs recording massive outflows including the second and third largest since inception on Jan 19 and 26, followed by large outflows on Feb 4. The price ticked up 5% to $65.9K briefly but continued falling amid market-wide panic.

items.title: Bitcoin Suffers Unreal Crash to $60K in Freefall
items.summary: Bitcoin plummeted to around $60K in an 'unreal crash,' with nobody buying the falling knife, as discussed in live morning analysis amid enormous market drops across all assets. Indicators suggest potential for further lows despite brief rebounds.

items.title: Bitcoin Down 10% to $65K in Stunning Fall from Grace
items.summary: Bitcoin fell about 10% to $65K per coin, down from above $90K just two-three weeks prior, amid a tech selloff and indiscriminate market selling, with prices deteriorating below $64K in a freefall. Volatility tied to broader market pressures including AI advancements and software sector declines.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Claude AI Discovers 500 High-Severity Software Vulnerabilities
items.summary: Anthropic's Claude AI has identified 500 high-severity software vulnerabilities, with human verification underway before reporting to developers. The discovery demonstrates AI language models' capability to identify novel vulnerabilities at scale, potentially exceeding expert human researchers.

items.title: EZMedTech.ai Wins 2026 Global Recognition Award for Healthcare Scheduling Innovation
items.summary: EZMedTech.ai received a 2026 Global Recognition Award for its AI-powered healthcare scheduling platform that uses predictive AI, reinforcement learning, and natural language processing to reduce patient no-shows. The medical scheduling AI market is projected to grow from $262.42 million in 2026 to $2.44 billion by 2035.

items.title: Moltbook AI Agent Social Network Reaches 1.6 Million Registered Agents Amid Security Concerns
items.summary: Moltbook, a social network built for AI agents, has grown to over 1.6 million registered agents, though security researchers discovered vulnerabilities including unauthorized database access. The platform represents growing accessibility to agentic AI for public experimentation.

items.title: Generative AI Advances in Decision Intelligence with Multimodal Capabilities
items.summary: By early 2026, generative AI has evolved from basic text summarization to sophisticated systems that craft scenario narratives and synthesize heterogeneous data sources. Multimodal AI models show 40% improvements in cross-modal reasoning compared to 2024 models.

items.title: Canada Announces $2.8M in AI Funding for Northern Economic Development
items.summary: The Canadian government announced over $2.8 million in AI funding to advance economic growth and digital literacy in northern regions, including projects for Inuit-led economic development and Arctic sensor data standardization.

items.title: Researchers Demonstrate AI Systems Can Govern Themselves Within Safety Constraints
items.summary: New research shows that AI systems can perform bounded self-modification of coordination protocols while maintaining strict safety limits and formal constraints. The study demonstrates technical feasibility of governed protocol modification using current AI models.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Reveals Switch 2 Game Lineup
items.summary: Nintendo's February 2026 Partner Showcase announced numerous titles for Switch 2, including Orbitals (Summer 2026 exclusive), Hollow Knight Switch 2 Edition (available now), PGA Tour 2K25 (February 6), and ports like Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition (February 24) and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle (May 12). Switch 2 is confirmed launching February 6, 2026.

items.title: Ubisoft's Might & Magic Fates Launches on Immutable
items.summary: Ubisoft's Might & Magic Fates is now live on mobile and PC via Immutable blockchain platform. This marks a notable blockchain gaming release highlighted in the weekly roundup.

items.title: GOAT Gaming Shuts Down as Wearemighty Pivots to AI Tools
items.summary: GOAT Gaming is shutting down while Wearemighty shifts focus to developing games using AI tools. The closure was noted in the latest blockchain gaming news roundup.

items.title: Nexpace Integrates Verse8 AI into MapleStory Universe
items.summary: Nexpace is integrating generative AI game-making technology Verse8 into MapleStory Universe. This development highlights growing AI synergies in blockchain gaming.

items.title: Nintendo President Warns of Memory Shortage Impact
items.summary: Nintendo's president stated that an ongoing memory shortage may pressure profitability, especially amid Switch 2 preparations. The company is focusing on global profitability amid potential supply issues.

items.title: Marshawn Lynch Partners with PHȲND to Challenge Gaming Gatekeepers
items.summary: NFL star Marshawn Lynch announced a partnership with PHȲND ahead of the big game, aiming to tackle video gaming's gatekeepers. The move seeks to promote accessibility in the industry.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Memory shortages hit smartphone chip demand, impacting Qualcomm and Arm
items.summary: A global memory chip shortage is reducing smartphone production, leading to weaker orders for Qualcomm and lower royalty revenue expectations for Arm due to softer processor shipments.

items.title: Amazon announces $200B capex plan, sparking market selloff
items.summary: Amazon plans to invest around $200 billion in capital expenditures including data centers and chips, surprising investors and contributing to a broader tech stock selloff amid high spending by Big Tech firms.

items.title: Nvidia delays RTX 50-series Super refresh due to memory constraints
items.summary: Nvidia is postponing its RTX 50-series Super GPU refresh to prioritize other hardware amid ongoing industry memory shortages affecting both gaming and data center products.

items.title: Samsung teases Galaxy S26 camera upgrades ahead of launch
items.summary: Samsung has released teasers highlighting improved zoom and low-light video capabilities for the upcoming Galaxy S26 series, emphasizing computational imaging in smartphones.

items.title: Huawei announces Feb. 26 global launch event for new consumer hardware
items.summary: Huawei is hosting its first Global Innovative Product launch on February 26 in Madrid, teasing multiple new consumer devices despite ongoing geopolitical challenges.

items.title: PayPal appoints HP CEO Enrique Lores as new leader
items.summary: PayPal has named Enrique Lores, former CEO of HP, as its new CEO in a significant leadership change for the fintech company.

items.title: Santander acquires Webster Bank for $12.2bn to expand in US
items.summary: Santander is strengthening its US presence through a $12.2 billion acquisition of Webster Bank, marking a major deal in banking expansion.
